title: Director, Product Design - Driver
content:
Director, Product Design - Driver
At Lyft, our mission is to improve people’s lives with the world’s best transportation. To do this, we start with our own community by creating an open, inclusive, and diverse organization.
Lyft is seeking a Design Director to lead our Driver design team. As a Design Director, you will lead a team of talented product designers, providing direction and guidance of the team’s output, as well as stewarding best practices in cross-functional partnership and design process. You will propagate a strong design practice, influence through cross-functional partnership, and create the spaces and structures that allow designers to create their best work.
You have both an incredible eye for detail and an ability to think big, break new ground, innovate and impact the business. You have experience leading teams, providing design mentorship, and you have a strong track record of work that demonstrates both clear wins to user and business impact. You are a thoughtful and proven leader, a storyteller, an excellent communicator, and a cross-organizational team player that is a champion for values, craft, and career development. 
We’re seeking a candidate who will advocate and maintain a customer-centric culture within Lyft, and be happy and comfortable in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment. You’re experienced with every step of product development, from brainstorming broad ideas to ensuring design quality through launch. Using your full range of interaction, visual, and product thinking skills, you will lead and own high-priority Driver experiences across our product teams.
The Opportunity
Our Drivers are our core customers—they are at the center of everything we make, build and create. We want to give Drivers an amazing experience throughout their time with Lyft, offering safe, efficient, and delightful experiences that help them make a living, support their families, and pursue their passion. 
By joining the team, you will have a rare opportunity to solve some of the toughest challenges while having a huge impact in the lives of Lyft’s Drivers. You will be creating industry-leading experiences, co-leading with talented, empathetic cross-functional partners on product strategy and process, and influencing team efforts to build high value opportunities for our Drivers and Lyft.
Responsibilities:

Manage, mentor and inspire a team of product designers, providing design direction and pushing the quality of the design work
Serve as a valued member of the cross-functional Driver Leadership Team developing the org’s vision, strategy, and roadmap with your product, engineering, and other cross-functional peers
Think through the holistic end-to-end Lyft Driver experience considering both the in-app and offline experiences
Push the boundaries of your team’s UX/UI/visual execution and explore new ideas. Explore divergent concepts and create trajectory for the Company
Define user lifecycle product strategy and lead your team in executing design work with a high level of polish
Understand how to solve a range of both tactical & contained issues to much more complex, loosely defined product challenges across all digital platforms: iOS, Android, and web
Know how to lead and represent your team effectively, substantiate the work and the decisions behind them, and be an advocate for user-centered design
Build relationships with cross functional team members and executives across organizations, and effectively speak to process, design goals and team vision as a strong representative of the design team
Step change productivity and accelerate team efficiency by improving processes and workflows with the design team and cross functional teams
As a member of the Lyft Design Leadership Team, contribute to supporting and advancing Lyft’s overall design culture

Experience:

10 years of design experience
5+ years of experience managing and scaling design teams
Background in product design (UX/UI), with a focus on mobile
Ability to think big and understand complex feature sets
A track record of leading design teams through successful product launches across iOS, Android, and mobile web
Strong information design experience with a solid foundation in UX design heuristics
Strong growth mindset and passion for data driven impact
Experience recruiting, hiring, and retaining multi-disciplinary design teams
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Applied experience with design and prototyping tools: Figma preferred
Superb attention to detail
Ability to work well on an ego-free, highly collaborative, and cross-functional team
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment

Benefits:

Great medical, dental, and vision insurance options
Mental health benefits
Family building benefits
In addition to 12 observed holidays, salaried team members have unlimited paid time off, hourly team members have 15 days paid time off
401(k) plan to help save for your future
18 weeks of paid parental leave. Biological, adoptive, and foster parents are all eligible
Pre-tax commuter benefits
Lyft Pink - Lyft team members get an exclusive opportunity to test new benefits of our Ridership Program

Lyft is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other basis prohibited by law. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.  
Starting in September 2023, this role will be in-office on a hybrid schedule — Team Members will be expected to work in the office 3 days per week on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. Additionally, hybrid roles have the flexibility to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per year.
The expected range of base pay for this position in the San Francisco area is $256,500 - $285,000. Salary ranges are dependent on a variety of factors, including qualifications, experience and geographic location. Range is not inclusive of potential equity offering, bonus or benefits. Your recruiter can share more information about the salary range specific to your working location and other factors during the hiring process.
